result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan John Blohm

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 12/12/22 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 2

Motion for Modification of Bond filed by the Defendant 
sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 11/02/22 sp

Pre-Trial Conference Data Sheet:
*Reschedule Initial Appearance to 12/12/22 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 2 
*Defendant is being considered for diversion program

Email from DA's Office in re:  INIT to be rescheduled to 10/31 @ 2:00 p.m. 
Removed from calendar for 10/24/22

Absolutely No contact with MLB. MLB can waive if completes family safety plan.
No contact with children CHB or BGB except provided in family court order.
No contact with MLK.
Take prescribed medications as prescribed and only as prescribed.

1:25 PM Defendant Ryan John Blohm appeared by video from the Portage County Jail.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls the case and states the appearances. 

Attorney Andrew Mutchler appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) states facts for anticipated charges of Stalking and Disorderly Conduct- Domestic Abuse Enhancer. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $2,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record. 

BY THE COURT: Initial appearance scheduled.
$2,500 signature bond ordered.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
